stream_context.summary: Kaze works on Part 4 of the overworld, turning it into an ice-cave tunnel that connects the early game starting area to the lighthouse summit. He fixes previously reported bugs, debates making the entire hub seamless, and brainstorms a new fast-travel system.

development_findings.summary: Fixed the end-screen transition timing and a render bug that players had complained about.
development_findings.quote: I fixed the end screen transition a little bit and it goes by faster now and the render bug is gone.

development_findings.summary: Part 4 of the overworld will become a cave section that lets the player emerge beside the lighthouse first seen at the very start, creating a "full-circle" moment.
development_findings.quote: You start overworld 1 here… go into the cave… and after you come out you're gonna be here up top at the lighthouse.

development_findings.summary: Kaze is replacing the entire hub; he believes the hub should be designed after the courses are well-defined to ensure proper pacing and information flow.
development_findings.quote: The hub is the most important part, you need to make it with all the information available to you.

development_findings.summary: Biobak is handling most of the level reworks and is nearly finished with Course 2.
development_findings.quote: There will be more level reworks but it's mostly Biobak doing them, I think he's almost done with course 2 now.

development_findings.summary: Team is considering making the overworld areas seamlessly connected via dynamic loading but faces N64 memory constraints and engine limits that prevent rendering during loading.
development_findings.quote: We need to unload the old area… then reload the level area… the game can't really render while a new area is loading in.

development_findings.summary: Current fallback for seamless transition is freezing the frame for a few ticks while the next area loads.
development_findings.quote: Maybe the game just has to freeze for a little bit… I think we'll go with that.

development_findings.summary: Sauraen is prototyping an animation-compression technique that could save performance.
Fast-travel ideas evolved from color-coded, corked pipes to a world-map cursor on the pause menu that lets players warp to unlocked course entrances.
development_findings.quote: Imagine the pause menu… instead was a world map with a cursor, and you could move over the world map and then warp.

development_findings.summary: Need to add death warps to every overworld area for soft-lock prevention.
Physical release of the soundtrack on cartridge is under consideration; a physical release of the ROM itself is ruled out for legal reasons.
development_findings.quote: I can’t release the game physically and I will actually get murdered.

context_findings.summary: Kaze has been ill for five days, affecting his appetite and energy but still streaming and coding.
context_findings.quote: Dude I've been sick for like five days… I have barely been able to eat.

context_findings.summary: He gets frustrated by constant heater/furnace noise during the stream but resolves it humorously when discovering Zeina caused it.
Design philosophy: maintain "suspense treadmill"—always give the player something visible and interesting to anticipate (e.g., the lighthouse).
context_findings.quote: You always want the player to have suspense for something that's going to happen.

context_findings.summary: Acknowledges legal risk with Nintendo and plans accordingly (OST only physical release).

biobak.summary: Leading the re-work of existing courses and offers design feedback (e.g., questioning pipe fast-travel).

zeina.summary: Suggests making overworld seamless and inadvertently causes heater noise that disrupts stream.

key_stories.title: Fixing the end-screen bug
key_stories.summary: Players complained about a slow, buggy end-screen transition. Kaze isolated the render issue and optimized the transition timing.
key_stories.challenge: Community-reported visual glitch and slow transition.
key_stories.process: Debugged the rendering path and adjusted timing parameters.
key_stories.outcome: Bug eliminated; transition now faster and smoother.
key_stories.key_quote: I fixed the end screen transition a little bit and it goes by faster now and the render bug is gone.

key_stories.title: Seamless overworld debate
key_stories.summary: Kaze and chat weigh the dream of a one-piece overworld against N64 memory and engine limits.
key_stories.challenge: Dynamic loading cannot occur while rendering, causing unavoidable frame freezes.
key_stories.process: Explored options (keeping areas in RAM, loading corridors, screen wipes) and decided on a brief freeze-frame as a practical compromise.
key_stories.outcome: Plan set: build areas first, then attempt seamless links with freeze frame fallback.
key_stories.key_quote: Making one area seamless requires knowing how the next area will look… maybe the game just has to freeze for a little bit.

key_stories.title: Fast-travel system rethink
key_stories.summary: Initial idea of corked pipes meets resistance; discussion pivots to a world-map cursor in the pause menu.
key_stories.challenge: Need convenient backtracking without breaking level design or immersion.
key_stories.process: Brainstormed pipes, cannons, Yoshis; Biobak skeptical; Kaze notes world-map solution and records it.
key_stories.outcome: Decision to prototype map-based fast travel unlocked once a level’s intro cut-scene is watched.
key_stories.key_quote: Man, that’s tempting… I think we need to do that. I will make a note.

key_stories.title: Heater mystery
key_stories.summary: Constant loud furnace disrupts the stream until Kaze discovers Zeina turned on upstairs heating.
key_stories.challenge: Persistent background noise ruining audio quality.
key_stories.process: Complains, speculates, then asks Zeina; she turns it off and noise stops.
key_stories.outcome: Humorous resolution and on-stream banter highlighting personal dynamic.
key_stories.key_quote: Oh my god guys, we found the reason… it was Zeina all along!
